How can I lock an identity using the `updateidentity` command, and what does it mean for the identity?

You can lock an identity by setting the `flags` parameter to 2 and specifying a `timelock` value, which defines the delay in blocks before the ID's unlock. A locked identity cannot revoke itself, and its locked status will be cleared if it is revoked.

- **Time Lock:**   The timelock parameter defines the unlock height of the identity.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - **Time Delay:**   The timelock parameter defines how many blocks to delay an ID's unlock when the flags are set back to an unlocked state.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 2, "timelock": <Unlock block delay>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height. - A locked identity cannot revoke itself. ### Conversion Queries The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves - **E.g. BTC ETH:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth   ```   Will return all currencies that have btc/eth markets at or above the liquidity threshold.### Sending and Converting Currency **Warning: All testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset**The `sendcurrency` API can be used to send and convert funds. - **Sending VRSCTEST from a single address (bob@) to a single recipient (alice@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Sending VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to two recipients (alice@ and bob@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to a fractional basket currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to another reserve, BTC through a fractional currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"BTC","via":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Preconverting to new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'   ```## Defining a Currency
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
How do I update an identity with a time lock using the command line in Verus?

To update an identity with a time lock using the command line in Verus, you can use the following command:

```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'
```

Replace `<Unlock block height>` with the desired block height at which you want the identity to be unlocked.

- **Time Lock:**   The timelock parameter defines the unlock height of the identity.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - **Time Delay:**   The timelock parameter defines how many blocks to delay an ID's unlock when the flags are set back to an unlocked state.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 2, "timelock": <Unlock block delay>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height. - A locked identity cannot revoke itself. ### Conversion Queries The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves - **E.g. BTC ETH:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth   ```   Will return all currencies that have btc/eth markets at or above the liquidity threshold.### Sending and Converting Currency **Warning: All testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset**The `sendcurrency` API can be used to send and convert funds. - **Sending VRSCTEST from a single address (bob@) to a single recipient (alice@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Sending VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to two recipients (alice@ and bob@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to a fractional basket currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to another reserve, BTC through a fractional currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"BTC","via":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Preconverting to new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'   ```## Defining a Currency

How do you preconvert VRSCTEST to a new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active, using the `sendcurrency` API?

You can preconvert VRSCTEST to a new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active, using the `sendcurrency` API by running the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'
```
This will preconvert 10 VRSCTEST to NEWCOIN and send it to the address "alice@". If the conversion fails, the funds will be refunded to "alice@".

- **Time Lock:**   The timelock parameter defines the unlock height of the identity.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - **Time Delay:**   The timelock parameter defines how many blocks to delay an ID's unlock when the flags are set back to an unlocked state.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 2, "timelock": <Unlock block delay>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height. - A locked identity cannot revoke itself. ### Conversion Queries The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves - **E.g. What does the `getcurrencyconverters` API do, and how can I use it?

The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves. You can use it by specifying the currencies you are interested in, for example, `verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth` to retrieve all currencies that have btc/eth markets at or above the liquidity threshold.

- **Time Lock:**   The timelock parameter defines the unlock height of the identity.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - **Time Delay:**   The timelock parameter defines how many blocks to delay an ID's unlock when the flags are set back to an unlocked state.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 2, "timelock": <Unlock block delay>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height. - A locked identity cannot revoke itself. ### Conversion Queries The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves - **E.g. How can I send and convert funds using the `sendcurrency` API?

You can use the `sendcurrency` API to send and convert funds in various ways, such as:

* Sending VRSCTEST from a single address to a single recipient
* Sending VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to multiple recipients
* Converting VRSCTEST to a fractional basket currency
* Converting VRSCTEST to another reserve through a fractional currency
* Preconverting to a new currency before it is active

The API command takes two arguments: the source of the funds and an array of objects specifying the currency, address, amount, and conversion options.

- **Time Lock:**   The timelock parameter defines the unlock height of the identity.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - **Time Delay:**   The timelock parameter defines how many blocks to delay an ID's unlock when the flags are set back to an unlocked state.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 2, "timelock": <Unlock block delay>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height. - A locked identity cannot revoke itself. ### Conversion Queries The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves - **E.g. BTC ETH:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth   ```   Will return all currencies that have btc/eth markets at or above the liquidity threshold.### Sending and Converting Currency **Warning: All testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset**The `sendcurrency` API can be used to send and convert funds. - **Sending VRSCTEST from a single address (bob@) to a single recipient (alice@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Sending VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to two recipients (alice@ and bob@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to a fractional basket currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to another reserve, BTC through a fractional currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"BTC","via":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Preconverting to new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'   ```## Defining a Currency

Can a locked identity revoke itself?
No, a locked identity cannot revoke itself.

- **Time Lock:**   The timelock parameter defines the unlock height of the identity.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - **Time Delay:**   The timelock parameter defines how many blocks to delay an ID's unlock when the flags are set back to an unlocked state.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 2, "timelock": <Unlock block delay>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height. - A locked identity cannot revoke itself. ### Conversion Queries The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves - **E.g. BTC ETH:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth   ```   Will return all currencies that have btc/eth markets at or above the liquidity threshold.### Sending and Converting Currency **Warning: All testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset**The `sendcurrency` API can be used to send and convert funds. - **Sending VRSCTEST from a single address (bob@) to a single recipient (alice@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Sending VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to two recipients (alice@ and bob@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to a fractional basket currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to another reserve, BTC through a fractional currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"BTC","via":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Preconverting to new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'   ```## Defining a Currency
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
How can I use the `sendcurrency` API to send and convert funds in Verus?

The `sendcurrency` API can be used to send and convert funds in various ways, such as:

1. Sending funds from a single address to a single recipient.
2. Sending funds from all wallet funds to multiple recipients.
3. Converting funds to a fractional basket currency.
4. Converting funds to another reserve currency through a fractional currency.
5. Preconverting funds to a new currency before it is active.

What is a Time Lock in Verus, and how do I set it for an identity?

A Time Lock in Verus is a parameter that defines the unlock height of an identity. You can set it using the `updateidentity` command with the following format:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'
```
Replace `<Unlock block height>` with the desired block height at which the identity should be unlocked.

- **Time Lock:**   The timelock parameter defines the unlock height of the identity.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 0, "timelock": <Unlock block height>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - **Time Delay:**   The timelock parameter defines how many blocks to delay an ID's unlock when the flags are set back to an unlocked state.   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST updateidentity '{"name": "ID@", "flags": 2, "timelock": <Unlock block delay>, "minimumsignatures": 1, "primaryaddresses": ["t-address"]}'   ``` - Revoking an identity will clear its locked status, regardless of time delay or unlock height. - A locked identity cannot revoke itself. ### Conversion Queries The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves - **E.g. BTC ETH:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth   ```   Will return all currencies that have btc/eth markets at or above the liquidity threshold.### Sending and Converting Currency **Warning: All testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset**The `sendcurrency` API can be used to send and convert funds. - **Sending VRSCTEST from a single address (bob@) to a single recipient (alice@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Sending VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to two recipients (alice@ and bob@):**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to a fractional basket currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Converting VRSCTEST to another reserve, BTC through a fractional currency, VRSC-BTC:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"BTC","via":"VRSC-BTC"}]'   ``` - **Preconverting to new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active:**   ```   verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'   ```## Defining a Currency
